moves.11... Nf6:
And here My opponent took some thought what to play. 
In postmortem he asked if played the right move.
moves.12. Bg5: And here I was out of book and loss for ideas...
moves.12... f4 13. Nd3 h5 14. h3 Nh7 15. Bh4 B: And here Black plays for fork x-ray tactic.
moves.18. Rh1: anticipating pawn exchanges and rook on the h-files.
moves.20... Nxf3 21. Bxf3 hxg4 22. Bd1 g3: In postmortem, Black said he didn't seen anything in Pawn-f3 check and what to follow up.
moves.23. Bxg3 fxg3 24. Qxg3 Rh8 25. c5: Queen-side expansion as Black current attack has stalled.
moves.25... Rh7:
!
And this was smart.
Black is focused on Rg7 pinning Queening to King and winning.
moves.26. cxd6 cxd6: It was here I thought of Nxe5 check...
moves.27. Rc1:
!
Rook on the open c-file will pay off!
moves.28. h5 Rg7:
gxh5; Bxh4+...Any King move; and my position is holding.
I was a bit shaky at this moment.
moves.29... Rh7 30. Nb5:
And White's queen-side expansion is in play...
25. c5; 27. Rc1; 30. Nb5
These ideas are very common in King's Indian
moves.31... Be7: In postmortem Black said this is better than any King move.
moves.32. Rxh6 Nxh6:
And here I assess that Black's Knight-h6 is out of play and not doing anything.
White has to attack now or wind up losing his Rc7 with a6
moves.33. Nxe5+:
Knight sacrifice with check!
My opponent stated he didn't see this
moves.33... dxe5 34. d6:
My plan.
My bishop can move with check, his Bishop is pinned.
In postmortem he said maybe Qxe5 is more forcing.
I liked my pawn attacking more than this....plus my knight is hanging and 
the pawn push protects my Rook too!
moves.36. Qh4+:
!!
White is winning.

Black's Queen-side Rook is undeveloped and Bd7 has only moved once and like I stated earlier Knight -h6 is out of play
moves.37... Qh8:
Black stated his only move?
Qe8 leads to Knight-d6 and queen-b8 leads to blocking in his own Rook.
moves.38. Rxd7 Re8 39. Nd6 b6 40. Nxe8+ Qxe8 4: I wonder if e8=Knight+ leads to mate?

opening: King's Indian (E99), orthodox, Aronin-Taimanov, Benko attack
